#summary JavaScript code examples for OpenHandle

[OpenHandleCodeExamples Code Examples]
== OpenHandle Java**Script Code Examples ==

Here's how a native Java**Script program (contained in file "[http://nurture.nature.com/tony/openhandle/code/javascript/openhandle.js openhandle.js]") can grab a handle data record.

Note this example uses an embedded JSON object since there are cross-site security policy restrictions in place to open an JSON object. It also makes use of the [http://www.mozilla.org/rhino/ Rhino] Java**Script engine.

To run a similar script in the browser would require a [http://bob.pythonmac.org/archives/2005/12/05/remote-json-jsonp/ JSONP] callback. A seperate template for OpenHandle will have to be set up.

{{{
% cat openhandle.js
var h = {
    "comment" : "OpenHandle (JSON) - see http://openhandle.googlecode.com/" ,
    "handle" : "hdl:10100/nature" ,
    "handleValues" : [
        {
            "index" : "100" ,
            "type" : "HS_ADMIN" ,
            "data" : {
                "adminRef" : "hdl:10100/nature?index=100" ,
                "adminPermission" : "111111111111"
            } ,
            "permission" : "1110" ,
            "ttl" : "+86400" ,
            "timestamp" : "Wed Feb 28 15:37:06 GMT 2007" ,
            "reference"  : {}
        } ,
        {
            "index" : "1" ,
            "type" : "URL" ,
            "data" : "http://www.nature.com/" ,
            "permission" : "1110" ,
            "ttl" : "+86400" ,
            "timestamp" : "Wed Feb 28 15:37:06 GMT 2007" ,
            "reference"  : {}
        }
    ]
}

var handle = h["handle"];
var values = h["handleValues"];
var value;
var i = 0;
var s = "";

s += "The handle <" + handle + "> has " + values.length + " values:\n";;
for (var i = 0; i < values.length; i++) {
    value = values[i];
    s += "\nvalue #" + (i + 1) + ":\n";
    s += "  index = " + value["index"] + "\n";
    s += "  type = " + value["type"] + "\n";
    s += "  data = " + value["data"] + "\n";
    s += "  permission = " + value["permission"] + "\n";
    s += "  ttl = " + value["ttl"] + "\n";
    s += "  timestamp = " + value["timestamp"] + "\n";
    s += "  reference = " + value["reference"] + "\n";
}
print(s);
}}}
